title: Version 110.1 Update - no longer keeping saved logins.
content:
I recently updated my Firefox browser, as prompted. Since the update my saved logins keep getting dropped, and each time I want to use several sites (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc) I have to login again. I have just turned off enhanced tracking for some of these sites, but this is annoying. Can I revert to the older version of Firefox? If not I may change browsers. I wish I had know you messed with security setting before I updated the browser.

Thanks Tom
creator: tbmaher2018

title: Browsing history is gone.
content: Good morning, On the morning of 2/21, I went to my computer to find it had restarted. All the tiles in New Tab were blank. On 2/21 at 9:15, the computer had again restarted itself. This time, the tiles were still blank, but now the browsing history was entirely gone as well. Bookmarks are still intact, so is all active log-in data. Search history is deleted, and so are some settings. I have checked about:profiles. There are 2 profiles there. One is the new one. I checked the other one, but it contains no additional browsing data. I have checked the profiles folder. It contains 4 profiles. In one of them, I was able to find browsing history from prior to 7/8/2019 and paste that into the current profile, but I cannot locate browsing history in the other profiles for 7/9/2019 through yesterday. What should I do next?
creator: jjmammi

title: Bookmarks

title: No synced logins found
content: After updating to Firefox 110 (snap running under Ubuntu Studio 22.04) I get "No synced logins found". The settings still show me logged in to my Firefox account and my synced bookmarks are still there. The saved logins are still there in my Firefox 110 installation running under Windows 10. A similar problem was reported here: Surface Pro 8 recently had No Synced Logins Found while other devices do not have this issue but I am opening a separate thread because the OP gives the impression that this is platform-specific. I am afraid to do anything in the Firefox installation under Ubuntu, for fear of overwriting (i.e. deleting) the saved logins which I can still access on my Windows installation. How should I proceed?

title: Firefox started to freezes/hangs after each 30-60sec and occasionally panics on my macOS after Ventura 13.0 to 13.2.1 update
content:
Firefox was working like a charm on my MacBook Pro '16 19 with Venture 13.0 macOS, without any issues. But somehow, after I did upgrade to Venture 13.2.1, Firefox started random hangs/freezes after each 30-60sec. And it takes ~5-10sec. I started to get random panics 2-3 per day.

I did not changed anything in the settings. This also happens in Private Window mode. I usually restart the computer everyday. (Eventually a new Firefox instance each new day, before Ventura 13.0 and still do after upgrade)

I have read the followings:

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/diagnose-firefox-issues-using-troubleshoot-mode
  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/refresh-firefox-reset-add-ons-and-settings

But didn't help me. I have everything (tabs, favs, extensions, works, etc.) so that I do NOT want to reset/refresh ANYthing. I'd prefer to fix the root cause and understand the issue why it keeps occur.

I either change my main Firefox browser (after 8+ years) or look for a solution to fix the root cause without doing any refresh or reset (or something that cause data lost).

Is this a known issue?

Could you please help me on this? Thanks!

My Environment:

  • Firefox 110.0
  • macOS 13.2.1

Also, in the Troubleshooting Information section below, browser somehow couldn't collect to data and showed a "manual way documentation" button. I clicked it and it redirected me a doc. When I back to previous page, I lost the data I've just written here. So had to rewrite everything... Can you please fix this?
creator: furkan.turkal

title: Right-click menu gets white due to Firefox Color extension's custom theme
content:

I noticed that choosing a light or translucent color for the toolbar within Firefox Color also switch my right-click menu from dark to white, which would be useful for most users but unfortunately not in my case. I'd like to keep the right-click menu dark while having either a light theme or/and a translucent toolbar. I have screenshots of the issue to better describe it.

Thanks in advance for any support you could provide, and for the time you will take to help me.
creator: rmanoa128

title: Curiosidades de Firefox...
content:
Me parece curioso que varias páginas que fallan en Firefox funcionen perfectamente en otros navegadores, y yo no haya tenido la necesidad de restaurar el navegador, ni de restaurar el equipo ni de reiniciarlo. En realidad las fallas se producen con cualquier página fortuitamente.

Lo mismo pasa con los videos. Se reproduce el sonido con fluidez, pero la imagen del video se congela cada cierto tiempo.

Y además de eso, las pestañas inactivas nunca terminan de cargar su contenido, se quedan ahí cargando y cargando infinitamente.

¿Alguno de ustedes sabe por qué Firefox produce tantos errores?
creator: ksg87849

title: Keep getting "connection not secure" on Washington Post site
content: In the last couple of days I have been unable to view comments or open some (not all) articles on Washington Post. I am logged into the site correctly. Everything worked on the home page, but when I tried to view a specific page (in this case the crosswords, of all things), the problem continued. I've clicked on the little padlock for the WP home page and on the "connection not secure" page and both say there is no security problem. What is going on? How can I fix this? I can live without reading WaPo, but the problem is just driving me nuts.
